metadata.title: NA approves 136 demands for grants worth Rs.9.011 trillion

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jun 25 (APP): The National Assembly on Wednesday approved 136 demands for grants, totaling over Rs 9.011 trillion, to cover government spending for the financial year ending June 30, 2026. Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb presented the demands in the House for approval. All cut motions submitted by opposition members were rejected by a majority vote. The allocation approved by the house for Cabinet, Cabinet Division, Defence Production, Law, Education, Health, Emergency Relief and Repatriation, Atomic Energy, Pakistan Nuclear Regulatory Authority, Naya Pakistan Housing Development Authority and Foreign Affairs, Prime Minister's office (internal and Public), National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), Board of Investment, Prime Minister's Inspection Commission, Special Technology Zone, National Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Financing Terrorism Authority, Cannabis Control and Regulatory Authority, Establishment Division, Federal Public Service Commission and National School of Public Policy, Civil Services Academy, National Security Division, Council of Common Interest, Special Investment Facilitation Council Division (SIFCD), Intelligence Bureau Division, Climate Change and Environmental Coordination Division, Commerce Division, Communication Division, Other Expenditures of Communication Division, Pakistan Post Office Department, Defence Division and Federal Government Educational Institutions, Airport Security Force, Defence Services, Defence Production Division, Economic Affairs Division, Miscellaneous Expenditures of Economic Affairs Division, Power Division, Petroleum Division, Geological Survey of Pakistan, Federal Education and Professional Training Division, Higher Education Commission, National Rahmatul-lil-Aalameen Wa khatamun Nabiyyin Authority and National Vocational & Technical Training Commission, National Heritage and Culture Division, Finance Division, Other Expenditure of Finance Division, Controller General of Accounts, Superannuation Allowances and Pensions, Grants Subsidies and Miscellaneous Expenditure, Revenue Division, Federal Board of Revenue, Foreign Affairs, And Research Division, Pakistan Agricultural Research Council, National Health Services, Regulations And Coordination Division, Overseas Pakistanis And Human Resource Development Division, Programme, Pakistan Bait-Ul-Mal, Privatization Division, Railways Division, Religious Affairs and Inter-Faith Harmony Division, Science and Technology Division, Water Resources Division, Federal
